intro: Ardisia rufidula, commonly known as the red-fruited beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Ardisia rufidula typically grows as an understory plant in humid forests, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
